revised_title: State-Dependent Life History Evolution in Soay Sheep: Dynamic Modeling of Reproductive Scheduling
tldr: The authors developed a dynamic optimization model to study the reproductive strategies and population dynamics of Soay sheep on St. Kilda. They found that the sheep make optimal reproductive decisions given the absence of information about the population cycle. This study represents the first use of a dynamic optimization life history model of realistic complexity in the study of a field population, and the techniques used can be potentially applicable to many other populations and species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Population Dynamics
